Number Playground

(my one-evening tribute to Numberblocks)

My three-year-old can already chant every episode title of Numberblocks by heart. She's cracked 0‚Äì10, sings the ‚ÄúDie Wunderbare Welt von Eins‚Äù song on repeat, and still begs to re-watch the same clips - because the music slaps and the math just clicks.

Last week, she randomly asked, ‚ÄúMama can you build me a new game?‚Äù Challenge accepted. Three coffee-powered hours later, Number Playground was born.

What you can do inside the Playground

ActionHowIdea
Duplicate blocksThrow blocks into the mirrorCopy / √ó 2
Stack blocksPick up multiple blocksAddition
Break blocks into singlesPress KSubtraction / partitioning
Rotate shapesPress TSpatial reasoning
Solve wall puzzlePush it in place to trigger fireworksProblem-solving
Remove excess blocksThrow blocks into the binClean-up

Right now the playground only counts 1 ‚Äì 5 since I didn't want to overload her. And also I am lazy.

How-to (for the curious)

  • Build time: ‚âà 3-hour late-night sprint
  • Tools: Vibe-coded in Cursor with Claude 3.5 handling the logic scaffolding, 3d assets generated by ChatGPT-4o image gen, then textured & rendered via Meshy AI
  • P.S.: A lot of copy-paste bravery and a ton of patience required

She's already pushing towers through the wall, shrieking when the confetti pops, and - bonus for me - practising addition without even realising it. If your little one loves Numberblocks, let them drive the blocks themselves:

üëâ Play the prototype here: Number Playground

Hit me with feedback; bedtime coding sessions are officially a thing now!
